title: 112_s221
content: The text chunk discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to the affordability of credit, payment for monthly premiums, and eligibility for credit for TAA recipients not enrolled in training programs. SEC. 3 amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make TAA recipients not enrolled in training programs eligible for credit, effective July 1, 2012. SEC. 4 establishes a pre-certification period rule for determining a 63-day lapse in creditable coverage. SEC. 5 amends various acts to change the date from February 13, 2011, to July 1, 2012, and applies to plan years starting after February 12, 2011. It also addresses the continued qualification of family members after certain events. SEC. 5 amends dates in various acts to July 1, 2012, affecting family member qualification after certain events. SEC. 6 extends COBRA benefits for specific TAA-eligible individuals and PBGC recipients. ERISA, IRC, and PHSA amendments change dates from February 12, 2011, to June 30, 2012, for PBGC recipients and TAA-eligible individuals. Section 2202(2)(A)(iv) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to change the date from February 12, 2011, to June 30, 2012. The amendments apply to coverage periods ending on or after February 12, 2011. SEC. 7. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code changes the date from February 13, 2011, to July 1, 2012, for coverage through voluntary employees' beneficiary associations. SEC. 8. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code changes the date from February 13, 2011, to July 1, 2012, for notice requirements. SEC. 9. Application of levy to payments to federal vendors relating to property. SEC. 9. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows levies on payments to federal vendors for goods or services sold or leased to the Federal Government, or property sold or leased within a 2-year period after enactment. Effective for levies issued post-enactment.
